alert.note: Alert for Johnston (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 12:59AM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Wake and west central Johnston Counties through 145 AM EDT... At 1259 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Fuquay-Varina, or 13 miles southeast of Cary, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Raleigh, Cary, Garner, Fuquay-Varina, Knightdale, Lake Wheeler, Lake Benson and William B Umstead State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
